name: BEST WESTERN Pioneer Inn

reviews.text: I spent 2 amazing nights with my guy at the Pioneer Inn in downtown Lahaina. I couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised by the staff, the setting, the rooms, dining, comfort, cleanliness, and the list continues. The details made all the difference, from the genuine, unforced smiles from every staff member to the personal greeting at any time of day, to the valentines day heart cookies waiting for us all day on february 14th, we were well looked after at this hotel.
reviews.title: Oasis in the middle of Lahaina
GREAT STAFF AND LOCATION!
reviews.text: And nothing fancy? I beg to differ - the minute you walk into this impeccably restored historic building you feel as though you're transported back to a time when shutters on the windows were commonplace, as were verandas, high ceilings with beautiful moldings and the most comfortable mattress I experienced anywhere on Maui. It was more intimate, clean, and welcoming (and yet quiet and cool in the middle of evening rush hour chaos), than any resort you could stay at. And all this with the convenience of the most central location in all of Lahaina.

I could not get over how quiet our room was, how charming and spacious it was, and how friendly the staff were. They took the time to learn our names for our brief two-night stay! And although you may be in a historic building, you can access a multitude of channels on the television - we even found Canadian coverage of the Olympics during our stay, which I could not find at any other hotel in Hawaii! Everything is so impeccably restored, and decorated in a subtle, classy way so as to remain warm and hawaiian, while not looking tawdry or stark.
reviews.title: do stay for a couple of nights

reviews.text: The next time I come to Maui, I will not be staying anywhere else. Great pancakes too!
reviews.title: Loved It

reviews.text: This hotel has a staff that is incredible. They will go the extra mile, or 10 if necessary to make your stay a winner. It is not fancy, it is not luxurious but it is home. While you are there, it is like you are a long lost cousin and have found your way home. All of Maui is like that to me for the most part, however it is over the top at the Pioneer Inn. I don't stay there for an entire 2 week stay, but I love to stay for 3 or 4 nights on the front end and at the end of a stay. It is part of the Ambience of Maui. I think it is also the oldest hotel west of the Rockies. And has a heck of a history. I get up early in the morning and take a walk along the coast. There is no place better for this on the planet. The Restaurant and bar are good too and have good prices. If you want fine dining there are several with in walking distance.I liked Lahina Seafood Company just a block or 2 down the street. Go about 9PM. get a table by the water, it is unbeatable. I recommend it highly. I have been to Maui several times and would be happy to give anyone more info or answer questions or give opinions to anyone about things to do etc. bob@oldcolonialmortgage(-)
reviews.title: Would stay here over any other in Maui

reviews.text: We stayed here from 6/9/06 through 6/13/06 and loved it. The location cant be beat, right in the heart of this quaint town. The room was on the small side but clean and besides, who stays in the room in maui except to sleep. The noise from outside is not bad, only one of the nites that we stayed(thursday) u could hear the music faintly(over the A/C) outside until 2am. The rest of the nites were very quiet. Parking is included in the price and was about a block and a half away, which was great because parking is not easy in lahaina. The beach is a 5min drive to kaanapali. The pool is small but very nice with tropical vegetation around it. The town is great with all the small shops/restaurants. We just loved this place and didnt want to leave. We highly recommend this place.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Pioneer Inn for four nights at the end of June. Prior to our trip, we were encouraged by all the positive reviews read on this site. And upon my return I see yet more positive reviews.
reviews.title: I don't get all these positive reviews

reviews.text: I'm not one to post a review like this, but I believe in this case people need to hear another side of this story.
reviews.title: Never Book A Reception Here!
A must stay, loved it!!
reviews.text: Let me start with the positive aspects of the hotel. 1) Price - if you don't want to break the bank, this place is certainly affordable. 2) Location - Lahaina is a fun town and you're right in the middle of it.

Now for the negatives. 1) The rooms are small, outdated, and felt dirty. The furnishings and ambience of our room was straight from the late 70's / early 80's. 2) Our air conditioner constantly froze up, was increadible noisy, and basically made staying there miserable. You obviously need a functioning AC unit in Hawaii and we didn't have it. Each time it froze we were instructed to turn it off for a half-hour (is this really customer service?). It was so noisy you couldn't sleep. Be warned - all AC units here are window units and, at least in our case, it didn't work at all. 3) Location - as far as beach access, there isn't any. As mentioned above, great for going out and/or dining, but horrible for getting to the beach. 4) Service - or lack of it. You know about the AC unit mentioned above. They promised to move us to another room after multiple calls about the unit. The next day theys said they could no longer accomodate a move. Also just seemed to not care about you stay / experience in general.
reviews.title: Great value - very pleasant surprise

reviews.text: The oldest hotel in town, the Pioneer Inn, is a local landmark. It’s smack in the middle of Lahaina. I stayed there with my wife and 3 boys (ages 11, 9, and 5). It’s not a place I would want to spend a week at, but for a night or two it has a great location while capturing the feel of Lahaina and its kooky, touristy fun.
reviews.title: No fancy resort, but a good value

reviews.text: The Pioneer Inn was built in 1901 and was the only hotel in western Maui until 1964. It’s now under the Best Western banner. There is a plaque at the registration desk citing them as one of the top Best Westerns in the country. I’m not surprised…it was definitely the best Best Western I have ever stayed at.
reviews.title: Lovin' the action!

reviews.text: They had a set of rules posted by the desk from when the hotel first opened. Some of them are pretty funny such as “If you burn or wet you bed, you going out” and “You are not allow in the down stears in the seating room or in the dinering room or in the kitchen when you are drunk.”. Fortunately, the boys remained sober and enjoyed climbing the banyan tree next door for nearly an hour. We had a great lunch at Aloha Mixed Plate and the boys satisfied their pizza jones at B.J.’s that night. You will not lack for dining choices in Lahaina.
reviews.title: Atmosphere of good times past
Very friendly hotel
reviews.text: Our room was a “suite”, although there was no separate sitting room. It was very spacious, however. We had a king bed and a queen pull-down Murphy bed. The hotel also has pretty decent and FREE wireless high-speed Internet access. There was a small lanai that overlooks an inner courtyard. You have no privacy on the lanai—it’s more a motel-like internal open hallway with the lanais separated by open wooden fences. Our room overlooking the garden was very peaceful, however. A number of rooms overlook the main drag, Front Street. I would imagine they could be pretty noisy and/or excellent vantage points for first-class people watching, depending on your mood.

description: When you visit historic Lahaina, treat yourself to the hospitatlity of Hawaii's plantation era while enjoying all the comfort and convenience of the Best Western Pioneer Inn. Although the exterior faithfully preserves this historical hotel, inside and around the grounds, visitors will enjoy up to date accomodations and facilities. Guests are surrounded by constant reminders of Hawaii's special beauty and will find the Inn's staff as warm and hospitable as a gentle island tradewind.
